title: Cleveland police say fight preceded West Side shooting that killed one, injured four
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A shooting on Cleveland's West Side that killed one and injured four others, including a pregnant woman, followed a fight that broke out at the eventual crime scene, police said.
A gunman opened fire about 11:10 p.m. Sunday outside an apartment building on the 3600 block of Bosworth Road. Several people fought there about 30 minutes earlier, police said.
A 47-year-old man who was shot in the chest died at MetroHealth Medical Center, police said.
Among those injured was a 22-year-old pregnant woman, the Associated Press reported. The woman was shot in the chest, police spokesman Sgt. Ali Pillow said Monday morning.
A 41-year-old man was also shot in the head. A 24-year-old man was shot in the neck and a 53-year-old woman was shot in the elbow, Pillow said.
Pillow did not release the conditions of the survivors.
Police have not said whether any of the victims were involved in the fight that led to the shooting.
No suspects have been identified. Several witnesses said they heard gunshots, but could not give police a description of the shooter.
Anyone with information is asked to call homicide detectives at 216-623-5464.
